title: How to Save Your Laptop After Water Damage with Rice

steps.headline: Turn off your laptop immediately by holding the power button.
Make sure the area surrounding the AC adapter is dry if your computer is connected to one.
steps.description: Subsequently, disconnect the power cord from the outlet.

steps.headline: Tilt the laptop at an angle to discourage liquid from reaching deeper parts in the laptop.
steps.description: (For most spills this may mean to flip the laptop upside down, but use your own judgment).

steps.headline: Dry the computer with paper towels in all reachable wet areas.
Use one of two methods that can be used to dry the computer’s internal parts.
steps.description: One method is to immerse the computer in dry, uncooked rice in a sealed container or plastic bag. Another method is to place the computer in a dry location. The moisture should leave the computer naturally.

steps.headline: Wait at least 48 hours.
steps.description: This time duration may seem excessive, but waiting for the allotted time can ensure that all of the water inside the computer has left.

steps.headline: Reconnect the power cord carefully to the laptop without the battery.
Test to see if your computer turns on and is operational.
Back up all your files immediately if your computer is operational.
steps.description: In some occasions, the computer will only function for a few hours before permanent failure.

steps.headline: Seek proffesional assistance if your computer is still not functioning.

tyn: Dry, uncooked rice. Preferably from an unopened 25 lb bag (optional)
Sealed container or plastic bag to place laptop inside. A 5 gallon (18.9 L) Rubbermaid bin container should work. (optional)
text: Turn off your laptop immediately by holding the power button.  Make sure the area surrounding the AC adapter is dry if your computer is connected to one. Subsequently, disconnect the power cord from the outlet. Pull out the battery.  Tilt the laptop at an angle to discourage liquid from reaching deeper parts in the laptop. (For most spills this may mean to flip the laptop upside down, but use your own judgment). Dry the computer with paper towels in all reachable wet areas.  Use one of two methods that can be used to dry the computer’s internal parts. One method is to immerse the computer in dry, uncooked rice in a sealed container or plastic bag. Another method is to place the computer in a dry location. The moisture should leave the computer naturally. Wait at least 48 hours. This time duration may seem excessive, but waiting for the allotted time can ensure that all of the water inside the computer has left. Reconnect the power cord carefully to the laptop without the battery.  Test to see if your computer turns on and is operational.  Back up all your files immediately if your computer is operational. In some occasions, the computer will only function for a few hours before permanent failure. Seek proffesional assistance if your computer is still not functioning.
sentences: Turn off your laptop immediately by holding the power button.
Make sure the area surrounding the AC adapter is dry if your computer is connected to one.
Subsequently, disconnect the power cord from the outlet.
Tilt the laptop at an angle to discourage liquid from reaching deeper parts in the laptop.
(For most spills this may mean to flip the laptop upside down, but use your own judgment).
Dry the computer with paper towels in all reachable wet areas.
Use one of two methods that can be used to dry the computer’s internal parts.
One method is to immerse the computer in dry, uncooked rice in a sealed container or plastic bag.
Another method is to place the computer in a dry location.
The moisture should leave the computer naturally.
This time duration may seem excessive, but waiting for the allotted time can ensure that all of the water inside the computer has left.
Reconnect the power cord carefully to the laptop without the battery.
Test to see if your computer turns on and is operational.
Back up all your files immediately if your computer is operational.
In some occasions, the computer will only function for a few hours before permanent failure.
Seek proffesional assistance if your computer is still not functioning.
